info.introduction: My name is James Lawton. I'm passionate about neuroscience, blockchain, robotics, and AI. I currently work at Max Planck as a blockchain & AI developer.

Blog.title: Blog
Blog.description: An overview of my written blog posts. I write about a multitude of topics, but tend to focus on my mentioned research fields. Specifically, artificial-affect, task generalization, robotics, blockchain, modifications to the current scientific publishing model, amongst others.

Web Development.title: Web Development
Web Development.description: I also build and manage websites and web applications for various clients. This includes decentralized applications, embedded neural networks, or performant and responsive websites for your business.

links.introduction: Here's a selection of projects I am currently working on or have in the past.

elements.title: Bloxberg
elements.description: Bloxberg is a scientific-focused blockchain consortium between various research institutions. These institutes run a node on a fork of Ethereum utilizing Proof of Authority consensus with the goal of providing scientific focused applications for researchers to enhance their work.

elements.title: Write like your favorite author
elements.description: Two concurrent word-level recurrent neural networks. This project extracts semantic and syntactic information from a database of any author with a sufficient body of work and provides the user input into sentence construction. It currently utilizes the Harry Potter novels, so you can write your own Harry Potter book!

elements.title: Meta Reinforcement Learning
elements.description: This project is an implementation of Meta RL, which essentially is a network that learns how to learn. The primary benefit is task generalization in that a single trained network can achieve high accuracy on multiple tasks in the same domain. This implementation is tested with three different bandits with varying degrees of difficulty.
